cause.description:
Free Press is a national, nonpartisan organization working to reform the media. Through education, organizing and advocacy, we promote diverse and independent media ownership, strong public media, and universal access to communications.
Free Press considers information to be among the most important resources to any society. We strive to open up the media system to allow more diversity of opinion to be expressed, to present a broader perspective, and to increase the caliber of information available to everyday people. Our work involves programs to improve the quality of journalism, protect Net Neutrality, stop media consolidation and save public broadcasting.
1. Stop media consolidation.
2. Universal, high-speed, neutral Internet access for everyone.
3. Save public broadcasting.
4. Improve the quality of journalism.
cause.mission: Free Press is working to make media reform a bona fide political issue in the United States.
cause.name: Free Press
